com.att.aro.video
Class AROVideoPlayer

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      com.att.aro.video.AROVideoPlayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class AROVideoPlayer
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

Displays the ARO Video Player UI, and provides Video player handling for the Play and Pause functions. The AROVideoPlayer class provides methods for refreshing the video frames when new traces are loaded in the ARO Data Analyzer.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setMediaDisplayTime

public void setMediaDisplayTime(double dCurrentTimeInSeconds)
Sets the current time position in the video. The video content, at the new current time position, is displayed in the Video player. The specified current time is validated to be between 0 and the length of the video.

Parameters:
dCurrentTimeInSeconds - The time position, in seconds, at which the video should be displayed. The value must be in the range between 0 and the length of the video.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the video player and its components.
